main event: Numerous pages from a Project Blue Book record card and U.S. Air Force Technical Information Sheets provide details of multiple UFO sightings in Dayton, Ohio, with observations including sightings of a white light with a slight movement, a light with a violet flash changing direction 90 degrees, and an irregular light, size of a bushel basket, moving at a steady speed in a westerly direction.
interesting points: The sightings range from a white light resembling a bright star to an irregular light, with some observations of a violet flash and unusual direction changes.
Witnesses reported seeing objects that were possibly meteoric, like a bright star, and even changing shape and brightness.
The observed objects varied in size, with one estimated to be about 30 feet in diameter while another was described as the size of a bushel basket.
Multiple people seem to have observed the same objects, as evidenced by the mention of talking to others and them also seeing the object.
The U.S. Air Force used detailed questionnaires and forms to gather information about the observed unidentified aerial phenomena, underlining the extensive investigative efforts.
sighted object: Various unidentified aerial phenomena, including white lights, lights with violet flashes, and irregular objects
photographs: No photographs included in the report
